title: Rosti: Bringing Excellent Services for Sustainable Growth of the Automotive Industry - The Korea Herald
summary: Rosti Group, a global precision injection molding company, is committed to sustainable practices and is rolling out an energy efficiency program across its global operations. Rosti's focus on lightweighting and innovation in injection molding and additive manufacturing, particularly with the use of Carbon's M3 printer, helps reduce emissions and drive sustainable growth in the automotive industry. The company employs green resins, promotes recycling, and leverages technologies like RHCM to reduce environmental impact and achieve sustainable production.
product_or_process: RHCM technology and Carbon's M3 printer
greenwashing: The article does not present evidence of greenwashing, as Rosti demonstrates concrete steps towards sustainability and environmental responsibility.

title: 2023 Capital Spending Survey: Assemblers Continue to Invest - Assembly Magazine
summary: The article discusses a surge in manufacturing construction spending in the United States, driven by investments in computer, electronic, and electrical manufacturing, particularly semiconductor fabrication. This boom is fueled by government policies like the CHIPS Act and the Inflation Reduction Act, which provide incentives for clean energy and manufacturing projects. The article also highlights the automotive industry's strong investment in capital equipment, particularly for electric vehicle production, as well as the increasing adoption of robots and collaborative robots in various manufacturing sectors.
official_company_name: Accelera by Cummins, Daimler Trucks, and PACCAR
likely_naics_codes: ['333111 - Motor Vehicle Manufacturing', '333312 - Motor Vehicle Electrical Equipment Manufacturing', '325998 - All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product Manufacturing', '336411 - Motor Vehicle Parts Manufacturing']
greenwashing: The article does not present any evidence of greenwashing, as it describes genuine investments in environmentally friendly products and processes.

title: ‘Our ambition is to make Tamil Nadu the R&D capital of India, if not Asia’: Dr TRB Rajaa - Autocar Professional
summary: Tamil Nadu, India, is aggressively pursuing an electric vehicle (EV) manufacturing and R&D hub strategy. The state offers incentives, a robust skilling program, and plans to establish a 300-acre EV park to attract investments and accelerate the transition to cleaner transportation. The state government is also prioritizing green energy development, promoting battery swapping, expanding EV charging infrastructure, and addressing the needs of MSMEs in the EV sector.
product_or_process: EV park, battery swapping program, plug-and-play facility for MSMEs
